title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: boston dog attack : postwoman left with 'significant ' injuries .
fire service 's apology over 'blaze risk ' fridge warning .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from us this week but we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 with more of the very latest .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
and finally here 's a final shot of last night 's storm , this one was taken by jordan in grantham and it 's a cracker :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: dog attack postal worker 'lucky to be alive '
text: the husband of sharon singer , the postal worker who was attacked by a dog near boston on tuesday , says she could have died .
mrs singer , who remains in hospital , needed four hours of complex reconstruction surgery and skin grafts to repair muscles , tendons , nerves and ligament damage to her arm .
dave singer said it could have been worse :
if the dog had her for another ten seconds she would n't have had an arm .
she 's lucky to be alive , it was n't a dog bite it was a mauling .
the dog mauled her .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: bransby horses charity opens new intensive care unit thanks to £ 175k of donations
text: leading equine rescue and welfare charity bransby horses near lincoln has officially opened its new intensive care unit after a £ 175 , 000 investment .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: local campaigners ' anger at return of plans for waste plant
text: campaigners in lincoln who successfully fought plans for a waste plant near their homes say they 're angry the scheme 's been revived .
officials threw out an application for the site on long leys road in february ; on wednesday veolia , the firm behind it , said it 'd appeal .
a meeting of the long leys road residents association took place last night .
its secretary jon davies says they 're furious :
probably can sum the felling up best with `` outraged and a bit insulted '' .
we had almost universal opposition to the original application from residents and businesses and they do n't seemed to have listened to that whatsoever
author: Rod Whiting
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: body found believed to be that of missing lincolnshire woman
text: police believe they 've found the body of 53-year-old joanne lewis after issuing an appeal for her whereabouts yesterday .
a body has been discovered in the river welland in stamford .
formal identification has not yet taken place but the body is believed to be that of joanne lewis .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: the weather this afternoon
text: gradually turning cloudier from the west this afternoon with some scattered showers , although these much lighter than yesterday .
feeling warm with light winds .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: weather watchers : spectacular strike !
text: we 've had a late submission from the storm last night and it 's a doozy !
this one is from lardyboy , taken in donington .
he says he took it on a monopod wedged against his front door frame , good work !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: body of murdered lincolnshire man found just two days before he was due to appear in court
text: a lincolnshire man who was found murdered was due to appear in court just two days before his body was found .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: postal worker 's injuries after dog attack
text: more now on the postal worker who remains in hospital after a savage dog attack whilst she was carrying out her round in wrangle near boston on tuesday .
sharon singer was set upon by a `` doberman-type '' dog and suffered serious injuries to her hand and arm .
her colleague russell warby , from the communication workers ' union , says he was horrified when he heard the news :
i felt sickened - you do n't want to believe it 's happened to one of your work colleagues .
we started in the same intake of posties i think there 's that realisation that it could have happened to any one of us .
the attack comes during royal mail 's dog awareness week which aims to highlight the significant number of dog attacks on postal workers , and to encourage responsible dog ownership .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : heavy traffic in horncastle
text: traffic is slower and heavier than normal on the a158 jubilee way eastbound around the a153 south street .
put aside some extra time for your journey if you 're heading that way this afternoon .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: demands for affordable homes making business 'nonviable '
text: more now on the story that builders in the county say they 're going to struggle to hit affordable housing targets .
rico wojtulewicz from the national federation of builders says companies ca n't afford it .
it 's not just about profits it 's about companies staying in the industry .
in the last ten years we 've lost about 60 % of small and medium sized developers and we 've had a decrease in the amount of homes being built .
to lose more of them , or frustrate them further , is going to make the housing crisis even worse .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: green waste stickers put to the test !
text: if you live in lincoln then you may remember that the stickers the city council put on garden waste bins were , well , a bit rubbish really .
residents kept complaining that they just peeled off .
well the council are n't taking any chances this year !
take a look at the new batch :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: theresa may says thatcher statue should go ahead
text: we told you earlier that it looks as though a statue of grantham born margaret thatcher may never take its place in parliament square .
well now the current prime minister theresa may say that fears that it may be vandalised should not stop it from going ahead .
lady thatcher , who was conservative prime minister from 1979 until 1990 , died on 8 april 2013 , following a stroke , at the age of 87 .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : the storm over newark
text: here 's a great little video from last night 's storm as it reached newark .
spectacular stuff !
slowed down the video of last nights lightning over newark , you can see the restrike , clearly two discharges
yes by all means
- i was waiting for strike .
was directly overhead newark for a quite a while
it was , some spectacular cloud lightning during the hail storm ; - )
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: businesses get their game faces on for return of lincoln dragon boat race
text: lincolnshire businesses are set to compete against each other in this year 's dragon boat race on the brayford in lincoln .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: job cuts expected at scunthorpe packaging company
text: packaging company mondi has confirmed there may be job losses at its site in scunthorpe .
the firm is proposing to make 60 redundancies at the site , where 140 people currently work .
the changes are designed to streamline operations and improve customer service , according to the company .
it says it 's currently consulting workers and unions about the changes .

documents.title: 'boris bikes ' coming to uphill lincoln
text: they 'll soon be a new way to get around the city .
lincoln is taking a page from london 's book and is putting in place 46 new hire bikes around the city centre- and new docking stations have been installed in the uphill area .
sarah hewberry from access lincoln demonstrates how they 'll work :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: plans for margaret thatcher statue scrapped
text: plans for a statue of grantham 's most famous daughter outside the houses of parliament have been blocked due to fears over vandalism .
backers had hoped the proposed statue of former prime minister margaret thatcher would join the likes of winston churchill , gandhi and other political big beasts in parliament square .
but there have been a series of objections , including the possibility it could be vandalised - and it 's also thought the statue does n't have the blessing of her family .
the parliamentary estate has also objected to the proposal .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : the miniature railway in search of a new home
text: volunteers who run a miniature railway near boston need a new home for it .
the evergreens miniature railway started life in a back garden at stickney , near boston , and now stretches to a mile-and-a-half of track complete with a signalbox , bridges , lakes and platforms .
it 's become a labour of love for a band of volunteers who are now looking for a new home as the land has been sold and the new owners do n't want the railway anymore .
take a tour of the track :
so far , the railway will go into storage at the end of the month and committee member rod timmis says it will be a sad day :
i think on the last running day there 'll be a few tears .
people have put a lot into it , a hell of a lot into it . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : a158 reopens after earlier crash
text: police say the a158 langton by wragby is now fully reopen after a crash earlier .
for a brief period the road was completely blocked as emergency services worked to remove the vehicles .
police say there were no serious injuries .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: weather watchers : lightning through the lens
text: some of you managed to snap great of the lightning last night .
here are a couple taken in scunthorpe by bbc weather watchers the mews and jojo :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: purse stolen from elderly woman in grimsby
text: an 85-year-old woman had her purse stolen in the middle of the day in grimsby town centre .
a man spoke to the woman before taking her purse , containing cash , from her handbag and making off .
the incident happened on tuesday at about 12:35 on freeman street and police would like to speak to the man

documents.title: boston dog attack : postwoman left with 'significant ' injuries
text: we mentioned yesterday about a dog attack near boston earlier this week which left a postwoman injured and needing hospital treatment .
royal mail spokeswoman morag turnbull has now told us the `` serious '' incident happened in gold fen bank , wrangle , on tuesday , when the postwoman was attacked by two dogs .
`` she 's currently hospital with significant injuries to her hand and arm and the matter has been reported to the police , '' says ms turnbull .

the royal mail 's fifth dog awareness week was just launched on monday in a bid to raise awareness of the issued of dog attacks and to urge all dog owners to keep their pets under control , ms turnbull adds .

`` seven attacks took place from april 2016 to april 2017 in the boston area and our postmen and women need to be able to deliver the service they provide without the risk of injury , '' says ms turnbull .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: woman , 53 , missing for last two days
text: police are concerned for a lincolnshire woman who has been reported missing .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: concerns over affordable housing commitments
text: promised affordable housing for lincolnshire wo n't be delivered if councils demand too much , it 's being claimed .
around 26,500 new homes are planned for the next 20 years , to be sold or rented at below market rates .
steve gelder of the gelder group says affordable housing can impact on the value of other new homes .
it 's great we 've made this commitment to build all these houses but how we 're going to do it , i do n't know .
i have a cynical view on this that we wo n't get there .
they can bring down the price of some executive homes down but that knocks profitability as well .
the department for communities and local government says councils are expected to reach agreements with developers of the levels of affordable housing for each new project .

documents.title: lincolnshire woman ordered to pay £ 100 parking charge - despite only being there for ten minutes
text: a lincolnshire mum has been left astounded after receiving a £ 100 parking fine for leaving her car outside the co-op for nine hours - claiming she only parked up for ten minutes .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: the weather this morning
text: after a bright and dry start , turning rather cloudy through the day with a chance of some afternoon showers developing , although these much lighter than on thursday .
still feeling warm with light winds .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: apology over 'fire risk ' fridge warning
text: lincolnshire fire and rescue has apologised to a major fridge manufacturer after issuing a fire warning relating to its products .
last week the brigade gave out advice regarding models of hotpoint fridge freezers after speculation one of the firm 's products was behind the grenfell tower fire in london .
but hotpoint has now asked the service to point out that the link has not been proven and no conclusions have been drawn on how the fire began :
we incorrectly stated that hotpoint 's safety alerts were due to fire safety concerns .
this was incorrect and we apologise for any concern or panic we may have caused .

documents.title: weather watchers : storm special
text: did you get caught in the storm last night ?
thunder , lightning and very heavy rain came seemingly out of nowhere and we got some fabulous because of it !
first came the ominous skies this was south witham , thanks to southwithamerbaz for this one :
then came the lightning !
this was grantham , thanks to phis75 for sending it in :
over to louth next where the appropriately named stromnut captured this :
in kirkby underwood g6ssn managed to get this splendid fork :
lincolnshire 's big skies made for a great view of this strike in nettleton , perries groto sent it in :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : lincoln 's new mp delivers maiden speech
text: lincoln 's new mp has used her maiden speech in parliament to praise the city - and attack the government over austerity .
labour 's karen lee won the seat in june , ousting conservative karl mccartney .
during her six-minute maiden speech yesterday , she told fellow mps about her background as a nurse - and the impact she believes austerity is having on the nhs :
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: good morning , welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here and i 'm ready to bring you the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather throughout the day .
something we should know about ?
you can reach us through facebook , twitter or email .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: extra police leave to help 'wellbeing '
text: extra police leave to help 'wellbeing '

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it for today - we 'll be back tomorrow from 08.00 with more live updates and breaking news , sport and travel will appear here throughout the night .
just before we go let 's look back at five things we 've found out on our way through the day :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: missing woman was last seen in rutland
text: police say they 're concerned for the safety of a 53-year-old woman who 's gone missing .
joanne lewis , from lincolnshire , was last seen in the tinwell area of rutland at about 15:00 yesterday .
officers have urged anyone who 's seen her to call 101 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : woodyard signs on the imps line
text: there had been speculation that he 'd join scunthorpe united - but alex woodyard has just signed a new contract with lincoln city .
fans had been desperately hoping the midfielder would stay at sincil bank .
we are delighted to announce that @ twitterid has signed a new deal with the club until the summer of 2019 .
sorry @ twitterid @ twitterid knows a bigger club when he see 's one # uti
how long has it taken you to get out of the pub leagues ?
stick to the singing sam smith
wow , real offended .
stick to supporting a shit team
he 's here , he 's there , he 's every flipping where .
woodyard , woodyard !
he 's here , he 's there , he 's every flipping where , alex alex woodyard !
brilliant news !
knew it would only be a matter of time , why go anywhere else ?
nice one alex.uti
great news !
raggett next ?
well that 's made a lot of people happy best decision he 's ever made !
going up
best signing of the summer by a mile .
get @ twitterid signed up next ?
brilliant news , wonderful footballer .
he 's a good lad !
best news all summer !
all we need is raggett now and we 're going up again !
top bloke and this is like a new signing .
ca n't wait for season to begin .
uti
massive news that !
get in !

documents.title: watch : action from lincoln movie set
text: we were telling you earlier today about the filming between lincoln castle and lincoln cathedral for mike leigh 's latest film .
it 's called peterloo and is based around the 1819 peterloo massacre , which happened in manchester .
castle square has been transformed for the production - have a look :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : duke at university for official opening
text: my colleague alex rhodes is at bishop grosseteste university this afternoon where the duke of gloucester is opening a new extension .
he looks impressed with what he 's seeing :
and with that the new section of @ twitterid is open !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: postal worker injured in dog attack
text: a postal worker has suffered what police say are `` significant injuries '' after being attacked by two dogs on her round near boston .
the attack happened on tuesday lunchtime on gold fen lane in wrangle and involved two doberman dogs .
the dogs have been seized by police - officers are investigating what happened .
the attack comes just a few days after the royal mail released figures showing dog attacks on postal workers in lincolnshire were on the increase .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police issue cctv of burglary suspects
text: detectives want to track down two men wanted in connection with a burglary in lincolnshire .
the theft happened in pennygate in spalding on saturday june 24 , between 15.30 and 16.00 .
if you recognise either of these men , call 101 and ask to speak to dc steve nesbit .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: job adverts go out for grimsby ice rink roles
text: the community group that wants to run grimsby ice rink is now advertising for staff .
grimsby ice rink community will find out next month if their business plan to take over the rink is good enough for north east lincolnshire council which ca n't afford to run it anymore .
ahead of that decision they 've advertised for staff to work at the rink :
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: council 'likely to reject traveller sites '
text: five possible stop-over sites for travellers are likely to be discounted by north east lincolnshire council .
the council were considering the sites , a legal requirement , but they 've told us they do not consider them suitable .
they 've told bbc radio humberside they 'll be drawing up a new list soon which will go out to consultation .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: public meeting about hospital trust in special measures
text: people will get the chance later to find out what action is being taken to get the trust which runs hospitals in grimsby , scunthorpe and goole out of special measures .
the northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust was told it needed to improve its quality of care and its finances in the spring .
a public meeting is being held tonight at grimsby town hall ( from 18:00 .

documents.title: save a life session a success
text: we train them young when it comes to bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign .
here 's four-year-old freddie learning cpr at our latest session held at waddington , near lincoln , last night .
he was among 45 people who learned lifesaving techniques at the village hall last night .
the campaign 's target is to train 10,000 people in cpr - at the moment we 're at more than 8,000 - we might have to revise the total
author: William Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: prison management 'now better ' after bad year
text: it 's been a challenging year for lincoln prison , according to a watchdog .
the annual report of the independent monitoring board for the jail says a lack of prison officers and sickness absence led to wing lockdowns and a restricted regime for many prisoners .
the watchdog notes that this had improved by the end of the year and better management was now in place .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: festive finance boost as lincoln christmas market turns a profit
text: last year 's lincoln christmas market made a profit of more than £ 25,000 , a new report from the city council has revealed .
the authority , which runs the annual extravaganza , says it 's mostly down to more people using the park and ride service at the showground .
the market made a loss in the previous year of £ 61,000 , but it 's estimated the four-day event brings £ 2.5m to the city and its businessses .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grotbags actress carol lee scott dies aged 74
text: actress carol lee scott , who was best known as grotbags the witch on children 's tv during the 1980s and early 1990s , has died at the age of 74 .
the character was created in cleethorpes during a summer season when she was performing with rod hull .
her family confirmed the news on social media , with her niece gina mear writing on facebook on wednesday that the actress had `` lost her brave fight against cancer '' .

documents.title: grimsby heritage project shortlisted for national award
text: work to investigate the poignant stories of grimsby 's heroic fishermen during world war one has been recognised .
a project called `` grimsby 's lost ships of ww1 '' is investigating at least 30 of grimsby 's trawler fleet that were lost in the north sea as part of the war effort .
the group 's beaten hundreds to be shortlisted for the uk 's best heritage project and is in with a chance of winning a £ 5,000 prize .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: basking butterflies on a sunny morning
text: here 's a lovely sent in from branston near lincoln this morning of butterflies on a buddleia plant .
a sure sign of summer !
thanks to barbara for sharing

documents.title: appeal to find missing charlotte
text: concern is growing for a woman from lincolnshire who has not contacted her family in the last 24 hours :

documents.title: watch : calls to silence 'britain 's noisiest road '
text: there are calls to to silence the a180 in north east lincolnshire :

documents.title: famous director spotted on film set
text: here 's film director mike leigh outside the castle hill club in lincoln this morning .
he 's shooting his latest film in the city today .
i 've been down there this morning to see what 's going on and there 's quite a buzz .
i 'll have some more for you here in the next few minutes .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cardiac rehabilitation team gives thanks for donation
text: members of the skegness liberal club have gifted £ 2,000 to a local cardiac rehabilitation team .
after a year of fundraising the members presents the cheque to the staff at burgh le marsh .

the team covers louth and skegness and provides exercise and education programmes to support those who have experienced heart attacks , surgery or other cardiac procedures to return to an active life .
this is a fantastic donation which will make a huge difference in enhancing the recovery of our cardiac patients who access the service .
it is wonderful that such a large amount of money has been raised through the commitment of the club and its members .
thank you to all of them .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire could benefit from government 'bypass funding '
text: lincolnshire could benefit from a major injection of cash into roads in rural towns and villages .
the government 's to spend a billion pounds a year on reducing traffic congestion across england .
the money 's come from the national roads fund which is paid for with vehicle tax and normally used for a roads and motorways only .
but the transport secretary chris grayling says he now wants this money spent on bypasses and relief roads .
the county council is welcoming the announcement :

we have many roads in lincolnshire that we feel deserve a share , including major strategic routes like the a158 , a15 , a16 and a17 , and over the next few months will give careful consideration to what we might want to bid for .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: royal visitor heads for lincoln
text: the queen 's cousin , the duke of gloucester will be visiting lincoln today .
his royal highness will be opening a multi-million pound extension to the bishop grosseteste university , as well as taking a tour of the campus .
he 'll then head down the hill to officially open the battles and dynasties exhibition at the collection .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: council softens line on grave mementoes
text: grieving families in skegness say they 're still not happy - despite the resort 's town council appearing to have backed down on plans to ban people from leaving items on loved ones ' graves .
earlier this year families complained that items were being removed without their permission at st mary 's cemetery in winthorpe .

the town council explained it was for health and safety reasons but they 've now changed the plans allowing for each grave to have a designated space for flowers and mementoes- measuring four foot by two .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police outline plans to tackle stalkers
text: lincolnshire police have set out their plans for dealing with the problems of stalking and harrassment .

following national recommendations by her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary , the force says it will introduce a range of measures , including specific guidance for staff on how to deal with the problem
the latest annual figures showed nine recorded cases of stalking in the county and 914 cases of harassment .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : chance of heavy rain
text: it will be warm but heavy rain and thunderstorms are possible .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: lights , camera , action in lincoln
text: a film crew has set up stalls in lincoln 's castle square .
it 's being used as a setting for a mike leigh film called the peterloo massacre .
dan gill from browns pie shop says it 's creating quite a buzz :
everyone around here , all the businesses , are really excited about it happening .
i do n't know how it 's going to play for trade but it 's really nice that lincoln is going to be shown off in such a bright light .
the knights from the lincoln knights trail in that area of the city have even been moved to minster yard .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to today 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln , it 's martin with you today .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: murder investigation after body found
text: murder investigation after body found

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: so that 's it from me today .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with more live updates .
breaking news , weather and travel will continue here throughout the night .
just before i go let 's look back at five things we 've learned today :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : cloudy with chances of drizzle
text: it will be a mostly cloudy night , with the cloud perhaps thick enough for some patchy drizzle in places , especially over high ground .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : look north headlines
text: here 's peter levy with the headlines from look north tonight :
here 's @ twitterid with tonight 's headlines from @ twitterid join us if you can at 18.30 .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: sir steve gives encouragement at sports day
text: more than 1,000 school pupils are being cheered on by a five times olympic champion .
the rower sir steve redgrave is at the mere 's leisure centre in grantham for a sports day for david ross academies .
sir steve says it reminds him of competing at that level
even though i was more of an endurance athlete at the olympic games .
the one i used to compete at at school and the district was the hundred metres .
for a big guy i could move quite quickly . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: could this be the end of louth cattle market ?
text: since the 16th century louth has had a cattle market , but today it 's been announced that could change .
east lindsey district council has discussed proposals for the site , before a report goes to the executive board next wednesday .
one of the options being put forward for the site means it would be sold off .
in the past that 's been balanced with plans for a new one on the industrial estate .
now the council says that might not be the best way to spend the £ 5m which would come from the sale .
craig leyland the leader of east lindsey dc says they have to spend money wisely .
a decision was made a couple of years ago to sell to a supermarket but that did n't proceed :
there is a great historical attachment to this cattle market equally there is a view in louth that this site would be better served by having another use and that would be retail outlet . ''
a consultation will start now with a decision being made by the full council in october .
the market could end temporarily end in december , but an act of parliament would be required to close it permanently .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: schools in north lincolnshire to receive £ 13.5m funding boost
text: a number of schools across north lincolnshire are to benefit from a £ 13.5 million investment in refurbishment and maintenance projects .

north lincolnshire council has confirmed that roof replacements , improving well-being in schools and providing more help for children with special educational needs will be some of the key areas where the money will be targeted .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: boston united and gainsborough trinity fixtures announced
text: the fixtures for the new national league north season have been revealed .
boston united start with a trip to southport before home games against alfreton town and spennymoor town .
gainsborough trinity begin at home to leamington before travelling to darlington and nuneaton town .
the derby takes place at york street on boxing day and the northolme on new years day .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: county police chief 'gutted ' over funding decision
text: today the home secretary amber rudd has announced 41 projects will share around £ 17m of funding to tackle violence against women and girls .
lincolnshire has not been selected for the funding .
lincolnshire 's police and crime commissioner marc jones says he is `` gutted '' :

the projects across england and wales will carry out a range of activities including providing support to victims , working with perpetrators of abuse to change their behaviour and helping to support children affected by what they have witnessed .
gov awards £ 17m tackle violence on women & girls .
gutted lincs ambitious plans to aid all genders awarded nothing .
lincolnshire looks to be about the only place that has n't been awarded funds @ twitterid
not far off and i 'd question how transformational some awarded really are .
happy for others but lincs victims deserve support too
lincolnshire often misses out ; catch 22 of services not being developed enough for investment but ca n't develop without investment
disappointing that lincs gets left out in the cold again .
unsure why only women and girls are catered for too ?
surely that must break some equality law ?
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police begin murder inquiry in scunthorpe
text: police have launched a murder investigation after the discovery of a body around the mary street area in scunthorpe ( yesterday morning .
a post mortem examination showed kyle bell , 25 , died of stab wounds .
police are appealing for anyone with any information to come forward .

documents.title: wonky bike sign gets a makeover
text: you may remember we talked about the 'wonky bike ' in sleaford yesterday .
well today contractors have been to london road and changed it .
here 's before :
and after
which way do you prefer it ?
i quite liked the first one
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln city footballer hosting workshop on mental health
text: lincoln city footballer nathan arnold is best-known for playing a key part in the imps ' success last season .
but tonight , he will discussing a much more personal issue when he hosts a workshop aimed at tackling mental health problems .
the player revealed near the end of last season he had been suffering from anxiety and depression since the death of his mother two years ago .
he is holding the event at sincil bank to help people understand more about mental illness .
he says sharing the problem is the first step to dealing with it .
if affected my personality , my body language , it affected my performances every day .
not just at football but in life in general .
the support that i 've had speaking about it has helped me grow as a person . ''
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: body recovered from grimsby docks
text: a body has been recovered from grimsby docks .
police were called at around 10:30 and crews from the humber lifeboat have been assisting with the recovery .
police are trying to establish the identity of the person .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: scunthorpe united sign deal with british steel
text: scunthorpe 's steelworks has signed a partnership deal with scunthorpe united for the 2017-18 season .
it means the british steel logo will be on the club 's kit (
it follows the announcement last year that the club 's new stadium would be built from local steel .

many of our employees support the iron and when we first started working with the club they were excited to not only learn the steel they make is going into the club 's new stadium , but that the british steel logo would be emblazoned across the players ' shirts . ''

documents.title: the headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories so far today from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather
text: the light and patchy rain should clear this afternoon , with dry and bright spells appearing .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: protest over lincoln nhs walk-in centre closure plan
text: campaigners against the proposed closure of lincoln 's only nhs walk-in centre are expected to hold a protest against the plans later .
it 's due to take place outside lincoln county hospital 's a & e at about 18:00 .
protesters say they hope to get lincoln mp karen lee , who 's also a nurse , to attend .
organiser tracey harrison says campaigners are passionate about the future of nhs services in lincoln :
we 've had the nhs to 69 years , we want to keep it for another 69 years or further .
and we need to stand up and fight for it because it 's not only us but it 's our children and our children 's children who will benefit from the service . ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses following assault in lincoln
text: lincolnshire police are appealing for help identifying three men who assaulted a man in lincoln .
the victim , who is in his 20s , had his nose broken and his glasses and phone stolen in the attack on wragby road on saturday .
it happened between 04:45 and 05:00 somewhere between the lindum sports club and the tesco store .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: it all adds up for burgh-le-marsh pupils
text: a team of pupils from lincolnshire have beaten more than 100,000 other children to win an international maths competition .
charlie , eryn , frankie and freya are seen here with the world championship trophy
the four students from st peter and st paul c of e primary school in burgh-le-marsh took part in a series of online challenges , before fighting it out with 30 teams in the final .
they 've now been crowned jaguar maths in motion junior world champions .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: last-ditch search for euromillions winner
text: time 's running out for one very lucky person to claim £ 1m .
a winning euromillions ticket was bought in north kesteven on the tuesday , 17 january , but no one has come forward to claim their prize .
the national lottery say if the million pound winnings go unclaimed the money will go to good causes .
the winning uk millionaire maker code vrms 13842 .
i suggest you go and check your old tickets !
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: our top stories so far this morning for our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: thousands of bottles of fake perfumes seized in boston
text: trading standards officers in lincolnshire and police raided the home of a person using facebook to sell goods in boston yesterday afternoon ( tuesday 4 july ) and found thousands of bottles of fake perfumes .
officers acted on intelligence and found counterfeit versions of chanel , dior and ysl .
the person was known to be selling the fake fragrances on over 500 facebook pages .
many counterfeit perfumes can contain poisonous chemicals including cyanide and even human urine which can be very harmful and toxic . ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: rise in burglary numbers expected - but not for the reason you might think
text: people in lincolnshire are being warned to expect a significant rise in burglary numbers .
the increase is due to a change in the way that statistics are compiled - rather than an increase in actual crime .
currently burglary statistics are separated into two categories - dwelling , those that take place in people 's homes - and non-dwelling for areas such as gardens or sheds .
the home office has now decided to change that - there will be no distinction between home and garden .
instead statistics will be separated into two new categories - residential burglaries and business and community burglaries .
lincolnshire police and crime commisioneer marc jones says the new rules will give a clearer more simplified view of crime figures - and allow police to better target their resources .
but he warns that in some areas it will appear that burglary numbers have increased .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : lancaster comes home
text: after nine months away the battle of britain memorial flight 's lancaster bomber returned to our skies .
she 's been away getting a `` deep service '' , including a new paint job .
pilot tim dunlop and co-pilot seb davey brought her back to bomber county yesterday afternoon from raf duxford .
a crowd gathered outside the fence at raf coningsby hours before to see the lancaster return home .
one of them was lois who moved from new zealand to lincolnshire because her father flew in lancasters during the war :
he was a wireless operator during the war so i came over to see it fly six years ago and i 've been coming back ever since
in case you missed it , here 's a video of the lancaster coming in :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : a dry and bright day
text: there 'll be some light and patchy rain across the north of the county as first .
however , most of today will be dry and bright , becoming warm .
here 's lisa gallagher with the weather forecast for lincolnshire :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning , welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , hope here , bringing you news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the county until 18:00 .
if there 's something you want to let me know about you can get in touch by sending an email , or heading to our facebook or twitter pages .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: patient killed 'between staff checks '
text: patient killed 'between staff checks '

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: so that 's it for tuesday - we 'll be back from 08.00 tomorrow with more live updates .
breaking news , weather and travel will continue here throughout the night .
just before we go let 's look back at five things we 've learned today :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wheelie wonky bike sign amuses residents
text: wheelie wonky bike sign amuses residents

documents.title: needle exchange : service will stay open until end of month
text: earlier we were telling you how the needle exchange for drug addicts was going to close at boots in sleaford ( below ) .
it 's after staff said they had been subjected to threats of violence .
the high street giant had said it would close immediately .
but after the story was up by bbc radio lincolnshire - which heard locals concerns about discarded needles - a deal 's been struck to extend the service until a replacement can be found .
the county 's director of public health tony mcginty says boots will host the exchange until the end of the month , giving more time for a new home to be found .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: gun amnesty : 13 weapons handed in on first day
text: lincolnshire police is currently running an amnesty for firearms .
officers say 13 weapons , mainly air weapons , have been handed in so far across the county , plus some cartridges .
here 's a video explaining what 's happening in the county :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: murder accused 'liked strangling women '
text: murder accused 'liked strangling women '

documents.title: witham wharf fire : ventilation fault blamed
text: residents of a block of flats in lincoln have been allowed back home - after it was evacuated at lunchtime .
fire crews were called to witham wharf near the brayford pool at 13:30 after reports of smoke in the building .
lincolnshire fire and rescue said it was caused by an electrical fault in the air ventilation system .
@ twitterid four appliances attending on going incident at witham warf brayford , hose attached to fire hydrant .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lancaster latest : aircraft expected back 'early evening '
text: the battle of britain memorial flight lancaster bomber should be back on the ground in lincolnshire by nightfall , according to the raf .
the aircraft 's been undergoing a major refit at duxford in cambridgeshire , but the aim is to get it back to raf coningsby this evening .
a spokesman for the bbmf said crews will make final assessments of the weather conditions before setting off .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wonky bike : contractor to repaint crazy cycle path
text: we 've showed this a couple of times already today - but i hope you 'll agree it 's worth another look .
it 's a representation of a bicycle rendered by contractors on london road in sleaford - locals think it 's been done freehand .
and they 're right !
here 's the statement from western power distribution , which did the roadworks and employed staff to repaint the road markings .
a spokesman said : `` the work to reinstate the cycle path was carried out by a contractor on western power distribution 's behalf .
`` it seems they did not have the correct piece of equipment to hand and so attempted to paint it freehand .
`` arrangements have been made to replace it tomorrow and we can assure residents that it will be at no cost to them . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: algae lake still safe for boating says council
text: we 've heard from east lindsey district council this afternoon which owns the boating lake in skegness affected by blue green algae .
although people are being advised to stay out of the water - public health england has said it is safe for the boats to continue operating .
a council spokesman said : `` the warning signage will remain in situ for the time-being , whilst we take proactive steps to address the algae .
`` further water sampling will also take place in due course . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: scunthorpe body : council suspend waste collection for five days
text: north lincolnshire council has suspended residential and trade waste collection over the next five days in the area near to where a body was found .
earlier today we told you that police had found a body in scunthorpe near mary street and investigations were ongoing .
the area affected ( includes exeter road , cliff gardens , oswald road and doncaster road boundary and all the streets within the area .
once clearance is given from the police the council will make sure all collections are brought up to date .

documents.title: son pays tribute to man killed in quarry incident
text: the son of a man who was killed in a quarry incident near grantham yesterday has spoken after police released his name .
richard marjoram , who was 57 , and from deeping st nicholas was killed at stainby quarry .
his son ben said : `` we are deeply shocked and upset at the death of my father , who was a very special husband to mum and also a fantastic father and much loved grandfather .
`` words can not describe how much we will miss him . ''
lincolnshire police and the health and safety executive are investigating what happened .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: flats evacuated after fire alert
text: i 'm down at witham wharf , next to brayford pool in lincoln where a block of flats has been evacuated after a fire alarm went off .
lots of firefighters here - but it appears no major blaze .
no word from lincolnshire fire and rescue on what caused the alert yet - more when get it .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: dream role for lincolnshire actor
text: here 's a selfie to be proud of for a jobbing actor .
steph genovese helped found the county-based holbeach film company but could n't believe it when he found himself on set with sir anthony hopkins .
it all started when he went to an audition for a secret film called e75 .
he had no idea who was in it or what it was .
a few months later , he was told it was transformers 5 : the last knight .
he was on set for 48 hours in southampton where he played `` large submarine man '' , alongside the famous actor .
he was a lovely guy - you 're not supposed to take on set , but when i told him my wife would n't believe that i 'd been acting alongside him , he said : 'take a
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: mike leigh movie bandwagon rolls into gainsborough
text: everybody thought mike leigh was filming for his latest movie - the peterloo massacre - in lincoln .
but it turns out that it 's actually in gainsborough as these sent into us by malc parr show .
the film is described as `` a drama based on events surrounding the 1819 peterloo massacre , where british forces fired on a peaceful pro-democracy rally in manchester . ''
it 's thought film crews will be in gainsborough until the end of the week
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: locals puzzled over 'wonky bike ' marking
text: we 've been speaking to paula brown , who took the of the `` wonky '' bike road markings on london road in sleaford .
paula brown spotted them as she was walking into town from her house and said she just decided to snap them on her phone as she walked past .
we thought it looked like a penny farthing , obviously the man had done his best but it seems as though he only had a machine that did straight lines .
you would n't walk away thinking job done - i think it would have been done better freehand . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: talks ongoing over resort algae problem
text: talks are ongoing between east lindsey district council and the environment agency over how to best get rid of algae which has forced the closure of a boating lake in skegness .
the blue green algae can be harmful to people and is especially dangerous to animals .
it occurs naturally and is ty caused by warm weather .
the visible signs are a discolouration and a scum .
it tends to be quite unpleasant . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wheelie bad sign leaves road users scratching heads
text: road users were left scratching their heads when bungling workmen painted a lopsided cycle symbol - which looked more like a wonky penny farthing . ''
author: Sleaford Standard

documents.title: cleethorpes sunrise this morning
text: it might be a bit of a dull cloudy day but one of our weather watchers caught this brilliant sunrise in cleethorpes this morning :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: city magistrates court reopens after alert
text: lincolnshire police say lincoln magistrates ' court has now reopened after a security alert .
staff and the public had to leave the building earlier this morning and specialist police were called in .
police say nothing was found and there was no threat .
the high street was also closed outside but reopened soon afterwards .

documents.title: body of man found in scunthorpe
text: the body of a man has been found in scunthorpe by police in the area near mary street .
police were investigating reports that a man had been seriously injured in what was thought to have been an assault when they found the body .
a 21-year-old man was taken to hospital for treatment to injuries that are serious but not believed to be life-threatening .
police have now launched an investigation .

documents.title: outdated views on hiv fuel stigma and discrimination - charity
text: would you go on a date with someone who has hiv ?
what about stopping in the street to give someone first aid - would hiv make you change you mind ?

apparently , loads of us still do n't understand the virus and , according to the terrence higgins trust , nearly a third of people in yorkshire and the humber region would be uncomfortable giving first aid to someone living with hiv on effective treatment .
the charity is now warning that out-of-date beliefs about hiv transmission are fuelling stigma and discrimination , which prevents people coming forward for testing .
mick mason , regional manager for the trust , says : `` it is saddening to see that , in 2017 , people in yorkshire and the humber are still being treated differently because of their hiv status . ''
joey steele , who was diagnosed three years ago , says there are still plenty of myths about the illness :
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: council chief to retire after 'personal tragedy '
text: the chief executive of gainsborough-based west lindsey district council manjeet gill has announced she 's taking early retirement .
she says she lost her son unexpectedly last year - something which has made her reflect on her priorities after seven years at the authority .

the current leader of the council jeff summers has paid tribute to her service and said : i am grateful that she returned to work so fast when we were in the middle of our devolution negotiations after her personal tragedy last year .
`` i also respect her judgment in deciding to step down now as i agree that it is the right time for the council . ''
losing my son unexpectedly last year has made me reflect upon my priorities . ''
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : lincolnshire lancaster bomber back in the skies
text: here 's the battle of britain memorial flight ( bbmf ) lancaster bomber - airborne again after a major refit .
the aircraft is currently undergoing tests with the aircraft restoration company at duxford airfield in cambridgeshire .
the bomber usually lives at raf coningsby in lincolnshire - and we 're wondering whether the plan is to get it back to the county in time for a royal visit next week .
the bbmf is celebrating 60 years - and prince william will be at the station next tuesday to launch the celebrations .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police appeal to trace relatives of deceased scunthorpe woman
text: police are appealing for the family of a 42-year-old scunthorpe woman to come forward .
deborah anne pulley was found dead at her home on dryden way in scunthorpe on saturday .
police say ms pulley 's death was not sus and they 've so far not been able to trace her family .

documents.title: magistrates court evacuated in security alert
text: lincoln magistrates court has been evacuated this morning after a security alert .
lincolnshire police say officers are currently at the building .
the fire service had closed the high street outside the building .
it 's not yet clear when the building will reopen to staff and the public .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police search for stolen farm vehicle
text: thieves have been out and about in rural lincolnshire again - if you see this machine you need to get in touch with officers :
# stolen overnight from hagworthingham a red manitou 627 vrm- fx57s just like the one any info to police on 101 - ref 83 04.07.17
stolen for a cash point raid perhaps ?
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: mp demands answers after whistleblower 's hospital letter
text: grimsby 's mp melanie onn ( has raised new concerns about claims of poor management at the hospital trust which covers hospitals in goole , scunthorpe and grimsby .

she 's asked managers at the northern lincolnshire and goole ( nlag ) nhs foundation trust to respond to allegations made to her in an anonymous letter which raises concerns about patient safety , treatment of staff and the way complaints are dealt with .
the trust have responded and encourage anyone with any concerns to come forward :

we take all concerns and complaints very seriously and investigate each one thoroughly patient safety is our first priority and we have clear processes that ensure timely , effective and robust investigation .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : cloudy start but bright spells later
text: we will get some showers during this morning but it should brighten up this afternoon particularly in parts of lincolnshire .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: update : train delays 'expected until 10.00 '
text: here 's the latest on those train problems between boston and skegness :
buses replace trains between boston and skegness until approximately 10:00 .
# thorpeculvert

documents.title: traffic and travel : level crossing failures
text: rail services through lincolnshire are being delayed because of a signal failure at 10 level crossings between skegness and boston .
east midlands trains says it 's because of a power cut at a signal box and means that all its trains between boston and skegness are cancelled .
the company is running buses between the two towns and says engineers are on the way to try and fix the fault .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: needle exchange closure sparks concern
text: there 's concern the closure of a needle exchange in sleaford will lead to more discarded needles being found on the town 's streets .
high street chemist boots says it 's been forced to shut its service after staff had to deal with increasingly difficult and dangerous situations .
the decision 's been made in conjunction with the drug support service , addaction .
boots says it 's working with the local authorities to find a long-term solution - but in the meantime people should use the needle exchange in grantham .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to today 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln , it 's martin with you today .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: worker dies in quarry 'accident '
text: worker dies in quarry 'accident '

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today but worry not , we 'll be back from 0800 tomorrow with more of the very latest from across the county .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : the look north headlines
text: here 's peter levy with the headlines from look north tonight .
from dog attacks on posties to patties in space @ twitterid has the headlines from @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: dry with some clear spells through the evening period .
cloud will tend to increase from the west during the early hours , but much of the area will probably remain dry with light winds .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: restaurants struggle with chef shortage
text: cookery programmes like the bbc 's masterchef might be popular on tv , but restaurants in east yorkshire and lincolnshire say they 're struggling to recruit chefs and catering staff .
there are more than 400 chef jobs available across east yorkshire and lincolnshire , but some restaurant owners say young people are turning away from a career in the kitchen .
some businesses say they are having to inflate salaries to attract talent .
the open university has calculated that a gap in skills has cost uk companies more than £ 2bn in the last year .
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: afc fylde sign lincoln forward muldoon
text: afc fylde sign lincoln forward muldoon

documents.title: dangerous algae closes skegness boating lake
text: east lindsey district council says they 've had to shut the boating lake in skegness because of blue-green algae which is harmful to humans and animals .
this is n't the first time the algae has closed the lake and it 's often brought on by warm weather .
the council says they 're keen to `` resolve the matter as quickly as possible and is currently considering the most appropriate and effective action that can be taken . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cladding from lincolnshire hospital sent for testing
text: cladding from boston pilgrim 's hospital is being sent away for analysis in the wake of the grenfell tower disaster .
the hospitals ' trust says it is just a precautionary measure and it 's confident the cladding is not the same type used on the building in london .
they say the testing is for peace of mind and to ensure the safety of staff and patients .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: local mps return to jeremy corbyn 's shadow cabinet
text: two of our local labour mps have been offered jobs on jeremy corbyn 's front bench , a year after joining the mass resignation of shadow ministers following the eu referendum .
great grimsby 's melanie onn has been appointed as a housing spokesperson .
there is also a job for karl turner , the mp for hull east , who returned to the front bench last year after joining the mass resignation in june 2016 .
he will be a transport spokesperson .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: police attending 'serious incident ' at quarry
text: lincolnshire police say they 're dealing with a `` serious incident '' at the quarry on crabtree road in buckminster .
buckminster is south of grantham and straddles the leicestershire border .
police say the road itself is still open .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic grinds to a halt as escaped emus go on run
text: a pair of escaped emus have caused traffic chaos on a busy stretch of road near boston .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: mental health unit for young people to be built in hull
text: plans have been announced for a new mental health unit for young people in the humber region .
nhs england says the multi-million pound contract will see the development of a new mental health service , including 11 in-patient beds .
it follows a long campaign by dozens of parents whose children had to travel more than 100 miles for specialist treatment .
in 2013 the west end unit in hessle ( closed its inpatient beds , because nhs managers said they were no longer fit for purpose .
the proposed site would be near the centre of hull and would work alongside the existing community child and adolescence mental health services .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: arrest after man seriously injured in crash with van in boston
text: a man has been seriously injured after a crash with a van in boston .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: man seriously injured in cleethorpes assault
text: a man is seriously ill in hospital following an assault in cleethorpes .
humberside police say the 47-year-old man suffered serious injuries in the incident on rufford road in the early hours of saturday 1 july .
officers say one man has been arrested and inquiries are continuing .

documents.title: the headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: what goes up : hull 'space pattie ' lands in lincolnshire field
text: an example of hull 's most famous dish , pattie and chips , has crash landed in lincolnshire after enjoying a short day-trip into space .
what on earth am i talking about ?
i 'm not quite sure to be honest
suffice to say , bbc radio humberside launched a balloon this morning loaded with their local delicacy and it headed just under 30 miles up into the sky :
with the help of a signal locator , it 's now been found on our side of the humber estuary :
and eventually
now , if you 'll excuse me i have to find a balloon to send a lincolnshire sausage back in their direction via space
it 's off !
our pattie and chips is on the way to the edge of space !
# operationpattie
@ twitterid remember the pattie at hull city hall ?
# operationpattie # dontforgetthechips
is this in reaction to that prescott speech demanding we send fried goods into space , not because it 's easy , but because it 's hard ?
let 's just hope the seagulls do n't get to it
we did it !
pattie and chips made it to space - and landed in a wheat field in # wragby .
they taste fine !
# operationpattie @ sent into space
@ twitterid @ twitterid but how did they stay on the tray ?
some amazing engineering ( and lots of glue ) !
ah .
glue !
i thought the photo was mocked up , but no .
brilliant
good job !
how did you track it and which camera did you use ?
drop us an email and we 'll give you any information you need !
info @ sentintospace.com
please do n't say that 's onion ?
one giant step for mankind
why though ?
well done
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: deal to 'secure future ' of scunthorpe steel mill
text: a scunthorpe steel mill has been rescued from administration after being bought by metals giant the liberty house group .
caparo merchant bar , which employs 145 people at two rolling mills in the town , went into administration in october 2015 .
liberty house says it 's confident the purchase will secure the future of the company .

documents.title: rise in dog attacks on postal workers
text: in the last five years there have been 200 dog attacks on postal workers in lincolnshire - and attacks have spiked in the ln post code area this year .
that 's according to new figures from the royal mail which is urging owners to be more responsible when it comes to their dogs .
a total of 28 postmen and women were bitten in the ln postcode area in the 12 months from april 2016 - that 's an increase of 12 % from the previous year .
clare hardcastle , who 's been attacked four times in her 19-year career , was left with scars on her leg in one incident involving three farm dogs :
it 's was a very dangerous situation .
dogs are pack animals , ultimately , and three of them attacking was scary .
it could have been a lot worse if all three managed to sink their teeth in instead of just one . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: olympic gold medalist georgie twigg opens new lincoln cycle route
text: georgie twigg mbe has officially opened a new off-road cycle route which connects lincoln with doddington .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: works begin to install pipe under lincolnshire beauty spot
text: you might see some heavy machinery in westgate fields in louth over the next six weeks .
a new water main is being installed to service new developments .
regan harris from anglian water says they 're trying to avoid as much disruption as possible :
this reason we 're going through the park is so we can avoid going straight through the middle of the town .
the good news is that people can still use the park while we 're working in there .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cadbury 's golden egg goes for £ 17,200 at auction
text: last week we told you about the 22ct `` conundrum '' egg going for sale in stamford .
it was the first time the one-of-a-kind item had ever been seen in public and exceeded its estimate of £ 15,000 , going for £ 17,200 over the weekend .
i think i 'll stick to the chocolate ones for now
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: the headlines this morning
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cake cartography in east lindsey
text: thousands flocked to skegness over the weekend for the final events of the annual so festival .
there was a strongwoman contest , fireworks and a 100m square map of east lindsey made entirely of cake :
skegness clock tower
alford craft market
raf east kirkby
and our personal favourite , taking pride of place , our satellite van !
out and about and broadcasting :
our exceptionally talented receptionist helen put this together , we 're just sad we did n't get to eat it !
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : weekend highlights
text: it was rather grey from monday to friday last week but it brightened up considerably during the weekend .
let 's see how our weather watchers took advantage of the better weather shall we ?
first , to the outskirts of lincoln where user eddie 's place snapped this :
next to gainsborough , where connielyn goss captured this little chap enjoying the sunshine :
this cow in holbeach has figured out her good side , smartie999 took this one :
finally as the weekend came to a close and melodysk captured this glowing sunset in sleaford :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: firearms surrender begins today
text: if you 've got an unlicensed or unwanted gun then you 're being asked to hand it in to lincolnshire police this week .
it 's part of a firearms surrender to stop them falling into the wrong hands .
supt phil vickers says they had a range of items brought into them last time :
we 've seen ammo , hand grenades , all manner of weapons handed in .
that 's good for us because it means we 're getting them off the street and they do n't fall into the hands of the criminals .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: the weather today
text: a mainly dry and bright start , but perhaps some early drizzle over western parts .
sunny spells will then develop through the morning .
these will then be broken up with scattered and occasionally sharp showers moving east during the early afternoon .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln .
alex here , ready to bring you all the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather updates throughout the day until 18:00 .
is there something you think we should know about ?
get in touch through email , facebook or twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
